newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP readies R3 for Internet launch.
newsitem.headline: SAP readies R3 for Internet launch.

text.p: German business software developer SAP AG said on Friday it expected to release an Internet version of its widely used R3 business management software in the first quarter of 1997.
Corporations using R3 version 3.1 could have their customers order products, check order status and access product data and other information over the Internet, SAP said.
Some customers are testing version 3.1 now. It will be ready for general release in the first three months of next year, SAP said.

The new version is a critical product for SAP, a world leader in so-called client-server business software that manages a company's purchasing, accounting, financial and other administrative functions.
SAP shares, which are listed in Germany's DAX index of 30 blue-chip stocks, closed floor trading on Friday at 207 marks.
The shares plummeted in October after the company reported weak third-quarter growth and reduced earnings forecasts. The shares fell 26 percent to 202 marks after the announcement.
SAP shares also slumped in the spring after a computer industry analyst's report criticised R3 for lacking Internet connections.
